content.body: Do you think it would it be backward compatible for Intl to check if the argument to `.format()` has a `.significantDigits` property, rather just checking for the internal slot?
content.formatted_body: Do you think it would it be backward compatible for Intl to check if the argument to .format() has a .significantDigits property, rather just checking for the internal slot?

content.body: For some delegates it's important to try to not check internal slots other than on the `this` argument, so that the feature does not break with membranes
content.formatted_body: For some delegates it's important to try to not check internal slots other than on the this argument, so that the feature does not break with membranes

content.body: * Do you think it would it be backward compatible for Intl to check if the argument to `.format()` has a `.significantDigits`/`.unit` property, rather just checking for the internal slot?
content.formatted_body: * Do you think it would it be backward compatible for Intl to check if the argument to .format() has a .significantDigits/.unit property, rather just checking for the internal slot?

m.new_content.body: Do you think it would it be backward compatible for Intl to check if the argument to `.format()` has a `.significantDigits`/`.unit` property, rather just checking for the internal slot?
m.new_content.formatted_body: Do you think it would it be backward compatible for Intl to check if the argument to .format() has a .significantDigits/.unit property, rather just checking for the internal slot?

content.body: while i agree with their motivations i think it's reasonable for static methods to check slots on arguments, altho no precedent has been set

yeah, I think this would make plenty of sense -- maybe we could do it in https://tc39.es/ecma402/2024/#sec-tointlmathematicalvalue for the case ToPrimitive would've thrown an error from no method existing
